Curriculum

The Open Curriculum for Learning Web Development

Javascript

!! This section is in the "Collecting Resources" phase !!

  • Codecademy's Javascript (from the Web Dev 101) http://javascriptissexy.com/how-to-learn-javascript-properly/ Javascript for Ruby Programmers: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wWIGEM4E9iw&list=PLxNY6twFc_xCxdSPLlxUS4C0VO3sni2DA

Books: http://cwebbdesign.tumblr.com/post/22508060129/4-best-javascript-books

http://learn.jquery.com/

http://learn.appendto.com/lesson/javascript-101

http://thecodeplayer.com/

Screencasts: http://devblog.avdi.org/2013/06/21/a-list-of-programming-screencast-series/ $$http://www.backbonerails.com/

https://github.com/hybridgroup/betterfrontend

Codeplayer game for snake: http://thecodeplayer.com/walkthrough/html5-game-tutorial-make-a-snake-game-using-html5-canvas-jquery

Tutorials @ Jumpstart for JS and JQ: http://tutorials.jumpstartlab.com/

Rebuild interactive features like a dropdown... start by building the tools, then use them, then abstract further.

Backbone: http://backbonetutorials.com/ http://coenraets.org/blog/2011/12/backbone-js-wine-cellar-tutorial-part-1-getting-started/ http://javascriptissexy.com/learn-backbone-js-completely/

Node: http://blog.modulus.io/absolute-beginners-guide-to-nodejs

Blogs: http://superherojs.com/ http://javascriptissexy.com/

Roadmap

  1. Introduction
  2. About Web Developers
    1. What A Web Developer Does
    2. Web Development Jobs and Careers
    3. Tools of the Trade
    4. Web Development Communities
    5. The Best Web Developers
    6. Getting Hired as a Web Developer
    7. Finale
  3. Installations
  4. Pair Programming
    1. Why We Pair
    2. How To Pair
    3. A Sample Pairing Session
    4. Finale
  5. Web Development 101
    1. How Does the Web Work?
    2. How Does Your Computer Work?
    3. Terms to Know
    4. Web Programming Basics
      1. Front End Basics
        1. HTML and CSS Basics
        2. Project: HTML / CSS
        3. Javascript and jQuery Basics
        4. Project: JS and jQuery
      2. Back End Basics
        1. Ruby Basics
        2. Project: Ruby
      3. Databases
      4. Web Development Frameworks
        1. Ruby on Rails
        2. Project: Ruby on Rails
        3. Backbone.js
      5. Tying It All Together
      6. Additional Important Topics
    5. How are Websites Built?
    6. Principles of Good Programming
    7. Other "Dumb" Questions Answered
    8. Finish
  6. Ruby
    1. Basic Ruby
      1. Building Blocks
      2. Project: Building Blocks
      3. Advanced Building Blocks
      4. Project: Advanced Building Blocks
    2. Intermediate Ruby
      1. Object Oriented Programming
      2. Project: OOP
      3. File I/O and Serialization
      4. Project: File I/O and Serialization
    3. Ruby on the Web
      1. Project: Ruby on the Web
    4. Computer Science-y Ruby
      1. Recursion
      2. Project: Recursion
      3. Data Structures and Algorithms
      4. Project: Data Structures and Algorithms
    5. Testing Ruby with RSpec
      1. Project: Testing Ruby
    6. Ruby Final Project
    7. Finale
  7. Git (Coming Soon!)
  8. Databases (Coming Soon!)
  9. Ruby on Rails (Coming Soon!)
  10. HTML and CSS (Coming Soon!)
  11. Javascript (Coming Soon!)
  12. Tying It All Together (Coming Soon!)
